definition: dawn/daybreak/to know/to let sb know/to make explicit

sentences.english: Rescuers worked after daybreak to try to reach those trapped in the rubble of collapsed buildings.
sentences.chinese: 救援人员拂晓开始搜寻被埋在倒坍建筑物瓦砾中的人。

sentences.english: In the dim light of the daybreak, I saw a dark shape looming athwart the door.
sentences.chinese: 在拂晓前昏暗的光线中，我看到一个黑影挡在门口。

sentences.english: The boats anchored along the shore at dawn.
sentences.chinese: 好几艘船拂晓时沿岸抛锚。

sentences.english: The brilliant shine dazzling me, I will be the dawn of the star.
sentences.chinese: 耀眼的光辉照耀着我，我将会成为拂晓之星。

sentences.english: They launched a violent attack on the enemy at dawn.
sentences.chinese: 他们在拂晓时向敌人发动猛攻。

sentences.english: The commandos attacked the outpost at dawn.
sentences.chinese: 突击队员于拂晓时袭击了前哨基地。

sentences.english: She had hanged herself at daybreak.
Nor you drummers, neither at reveille at dawn.
sentences.chinese: 鼓手莫悲，拂晓晨号你不要吹。

sentences.english: At dawn, two tremors shook Melbourne.
sentences.chinese: 拂晓时分，墨尔本遭受再次震颤。

sentences.english: Dawn gave a yawn as the sun began to burn its horizon on the lower…
sentences.chinese: 当新地一天太阳从地平线升起地时分，拂晓来啦。

sentences.english: Being with you is like walking on definitely a clear morning.
sentences.chinese: 和你在一起就像在一个清新的拂晓闲步，。

sentences.english: The enemy opened fire on our lines at early dawn.
sentences.chinese: 拂晓时敌人向我阵线开了火。

sentences.english: they were nowhere in the house, nor about the moonlit dawn.
sentences.chinese: 他们不在屋子里，也不在洒满月光的拂晓。

sentences.english: By sunup, Jonathan Gull was practicing again.
sentences.chinese: 拂晓时分，海鸥乔纳森又在练习了。

sentences.english: I hear the clacking of computer keyboards in the hours before dawn.
sentences.chinese: 拂晓之前我还听见计算机键盘的敲击声。

sentences.english: The police swooped on the house at dawn.
sentences.chinese: 警察拂晓对房子进行突击检查。

definition: first rays of morning sun/first glimmer of dawn
in the evening/when night falls/towards evening/at night fall/at dusk
